full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/21/2023 UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE REPORT OF INVESTIGATION TITLE FILE NUMBER (1) WONG, Ramon Fong Song (1) A17 984 698 (2) WONG, Yuk Lin Chan (2) A18 435 377 REPORT MADE AT DATE Los Angeles, Calif. 1/14/69 P.O. Guio Investigator SYNOPSIS WONG, RAMON FONG SONG, a native of China, citizen and resident of Mexico, was admitted as a sixth preference immigrant as a Chinese cook. On entry he was destined to the Holly Cafe at 452 Main Street, El Centro, California. Mr. LOO, FONG HAY, owner of the Holly Cafe had sponsored RAMON WONG and signed form ES 575facilitating his entry for permanent residence. After entry, SUBJECT RAMON WONG did not accept employment at the Holly Cafe as specified in the form ES 575, but proceeded to Los Angeles where he is presently residing. Since entry he has accepted employment for a brief time as a cook's helper at the "FAR EAST TERRACE" resturant at 4123 Lankershim Boulevar, North Hollywood, California. After the entry of SUBJECT RAMON WONG, he submitted a visa petition for his wife, WONG, YUK LIN CHAN, a resident of Hong Kong. FORM G-166 (REV. 7-1-64) FPI-LPC-10-67-27M-3329
